TextView.android:text: Selecting the Weight: \n- Choose a pair of dumbbells with a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form throughout the exercise. \n- Start with lighter weights if you're new to the exercise and gradually increase the weight as you become stronger.

Starting Position: 
- Stand upright with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended by your sides, and palms facing your body. 
- Keep your feet shoulder-width apart for stability. 
Gripping the Dumbbells: 
- Hold the dumbbells with a firm grip, ensuring that your wrists are straight and aligned with your forearms. 
- Your thumbs should be pointing forward.

Curling Motion: 
- Keeping your upper arms stationary and your elbows close to your sides, exhale and slowly curl the dumbbells upward by flexing your elbows. 
- Focus on squeezing your biceps and forearms as you lift the dumbbells. 
- Avoid using momentum or swinging the weights to lift them. Focus on controlled movements to maximize muscle engagement and minimize the risk of injury.
